title: Senior Application Security Engineer, Reviews
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.


Application Security Engineers are responsible for conducting security reviews on all of Okta's products, providing security education to our engineers, and handling externally reported vulnerabilities. This ranges from code reviews, penetration tests, and architectural reviews on new features and existing code, in order to provide security education and guidance to the entire organization.



This position is not for someone who operates solely on scanner-based vulnerabilities. You will be required to demonstrate a strong technical understanding of web applications, backend services, penetration testing techniques and methodologies. You should have a clear understanding of Okta's authentication protocols, such as SAML and OAuth. Furthermore, you should have the desire to automate tasks by building tools to help discover vulnerabilities and be comfortable explaining and communicating vulnerabilities to developers, management and leadership by creating thorough documentation of findings.



The most important quality we are looking for is someone who has an "evil bit" - an innate ability to think and operate like an attacker while solving complex problems with expertise and creativity. At Okta we fully support externally publishing exciting new findings and will help you do it in the form of white papers, blog posts, and live presentations at conferences of your choice.



Job Duties and Responsibilities:


* Work closely with Engineering teams on Design Reviews for new features or major changes
* Audit code for security flaws and best practices
* Perform Penetration Tests on new features and on the platform as a whole
* Develop, implement, and communicate vulnerability mitigation strategies to development teams
* Work solo and collaboratively to deliver projects on a deadline
* Think like an attacker and solve complex problems with expertise and ingenuity
* Give security presentations and represent Okta in private or public venues


Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:


* Ability to identify common (OWASP Top 10/CWE Top 25) web application vulnerabilities through secure code review (Java, .Net, Go, C, C++, C#, Swift, Kotlin, Python)
* Ability to conduct a manual Web Application Penetration Test using industry standard tools (ex: Burp Suite)
* Knowledge of modern web application components, architecture, and design principles
* Ability to explain vulnerability risks and remediation options to developers
* Beginner level coding ability in at least one scripting language (ex: Python, Bash)


 Desired skills and Abilities:


* Knowledge in current authentication and authorization protocols (OIDC, SAML)
* Experience in mobile device (Android and/or iOS) application penetration testing
* Experience with SAST, DAST, SCA, and fuzzing tools
* Knowledge in current cryptographic algorithms and techniques
* Experience in attacking network protocols and analyzing network traffic
* Experience writing proof of concept scripts to demonstrate vulnerability exploitation

  



#LI-Remote



#LI-CH1

In addition, Okta offers equity (where applicable), bonus, and benefits, including health, dental, and vision insurance, RRSP with a match, healthcare spending, telemedicine, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. $114,000—$172,000 CAD**What you can look forward to as an Okta employee!**

title: Sales Engineer / Account Manager - Semiconductor Industry, Automated Test Equipment
description:
We are the global test and automation specialists, powering next-generation technologies through sophisticated solutions. Behind every electronic device you use, Teradyne's test technology ensures your device works right the first time, every time! Our portfolio of automation solutions help manufacturers to develop and deliver products quickly, efficiently and cost-effectively. Together, Teradyne companies deliver manufacturing automation across industries and applications around the world!


Teradyne’s semiconductor test solutions bring the technology of tomorrow to market fast and with high quality. We are transforming the way the industry tests chipsets for automotive, industrial, communications, consumer, smartphones, and computer and electronic game applications.

  

Teradyne has an opportunity for an experienced Account Manager/Sales Engineer. Do you possess a unique blend of Engineering background, Semiconductor industry experience, a strong desire to advocate for and support customers while influencing our company’s sales and product roadmap?

  

This individual is an experienced sales professional who has ATE or related experience and excels in managing a cross functional Customer Team. You are able to work independently with little supervision and can also manage a cross functional Customer team on a global basis. Both the company and Customer see and rely on you as a trusted adviser.  

  

**Duties & Responsibilities:**  

* Advocate for and Support the Customer, while aligning to the objectives of Teradyne.
* Manage and grow the business for established and new customers.
* Create and implement sales strategy using strategic sales tools and processes.
* Manage all activities related to maintaining existing and gaining new market share and meeting sales quota: identify and qualify opportunities, manage the competitive sales process, align Teradyne product roadmaps, forecast, quote and book orders.
* Coordinate sales strategies worldwide for the assigned Customers (including integration with Teradyne worldwide test subcontract sales teams).
* Develop relationships at all levels within the Customers’ organizations and within Teradyne.
* Must be willing to travel 25+%


  

**Qualifications and Experience:**  

* 3 plus years of experience in capital equipment sales or marketing within the Semiconductor or a related industry.
* Proven ability to drive long sales cycle design-ins.
* Highly empathetic to Customer needs
* Excellent communication and analytical skills


  

**Education:**  

BSEE or equivalent work experience. MBA a plus.  

#LI-JL2


#LI-Remote

title: Control & Automation Specialist (SCADA & HMI)
description:
**Control & Automation Specialist (SCADA & HMI)**

Position Number: EFF-CA-2202CAS

Efficot is a Canadian startup founded in 2022 that specializes in providing energy efficiency solutions for industrial processes. As part of its strategic plan, Efficot aims to form alliances and partnerships with Canadian organizations to introduce and implement their clean fuels technologies, energy efficiency, and energy transition solutions in Latin American countries.

The company was originally established in Ecuador in 2020 and has since completed projects in various countries throughout the Andean region in Energy Management Systems, Energy Audits, Energy Efficiency, Industrial Automation, Industrial Communications, Construction Certifications and Sustainable Operation.

**Essential Activities and Responsibilities:**

The Control & Automation Specialist (SCADA & HMI) is responsible for the entire process of specifying, designing, configuring, and testing SCADA systems. In this role, they act as a technical reference point for designers and engineering technicians who are involved in automation, instrumentation, and the integration/development of control systems.

**Requirements and Preferred Qualifications:**

· A bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related field is required.

· +5 years of experience in designing, installing, commissioning, servicing, and troubleshooting is required.

· ICONICS - GENESIS64™ advanced HMI SCADA knowledge is required.

· Rockwell™ PLC Programming (RS Logix 500 & 5000), Schneider™ Modicon, Simens™ & Others is preferred.

· English language is required.

· Fluent in Spanish (Latin American clients) is preferred.

· Advanced knowledge of Microsoft 365 is required.

· Knowledge of Ms Project is required.

**Daily tasks to perform.**

· Design and maintain customized machines and applications utilizing PLC (both hardware and software) is required.

· Execute PLC logic and programming tasks during build and debug stages at our build locations.

· Introduce programming enhancements in controls and logic systems to align with customer changes or manufacturing requirements.

· Debugged, tested, and validated I/O signals and interference zones in the system, and meticulously documented control logic changes in collaboration with the engineering team.

· Provide timely status updates on projects, ensuring deadlines are met.

· Install, configure, and monitor SCADA servers, interfaces, tags, and user tools.

· Perform administrative functions on the SCADA system company-wide.

· Consult with the engineer's team and other engineering staff to assess interfaces between Hardware, Software, and operational requirements, ensuring overall system performance.

· Configure Historian Servers Interface nodes and reports.

· Collaborate with the Analytics team to align work with the Analytics Platform.

· Monitor application server, perform operating system triage and log translation, and support Operating System/Software services and ecosystem.

· Collaborate and troubleshoot with infrastructure groups, including server, storage, and network management, as well as enterprise architects.

· Resolve incidents and problems and actively contribute to change initiatives.

**Preferred skills**

· Highly effective interpersonal skills.

· Skill to prioritize tasks and maintain a balance between work and personal life.

· Teamwork skills and a collaborative approach to work.

· Able to multitask and prioritize the workload.

· Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills,

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $51,687.14-$70,000.00 per year

Flexible Language Requirement:

* French not required

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

Application deadline: 2024-03-07  
Expected start date: 2024-03-18

title: Cloud Automation Engineer
description:
***JOB TITLE:*** Cloud Automation Engineer


***EMPLOYEE TYPE:*** Full-Time Hourly Non-Exempt


***TRAVEL REQUIRED:*** No ***RELOCATION:*** No


**About The Company:**


Cayuse Technologies launched in 2006 as a US-based alternative to offshore technology delivery centers, providing information technology solutions and subject matter expertise to our clientele. Cayuse focuses on federal markets and missions and is an SBA tribal 8(a) certified company. Cayuse brings significant past performance and excellent CPARS to its clients at an exceptionally competitive price. Cayuse's 41,000 sq. ft. technology delivery center is fully redundant and prepared to meet the needs of government. Our clients include DHS, DHA, DoS, USMC, US Army, HHS/Indian Health Service, Department of Interior, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Indian Education, among many more.


**Primary Focus**

This position will be part of the Enterprise Engineering Team that encompasses the engineering and technical support services required to research, design, model, test, pilot, and implement the systems and infrastructure required to deliver voice, video, network, compute, and data services for the USACE Enterprise.


**Job Responsibilities**


* Designs, plans, and integrates cloud and virtualization technologies, using infrastructure as code and agile frameworks.
* Develops automation scripts for efficient deployment and operations of cloud and virtualization systems.
* Develops and conducts testing of cloud and virtualization systems.
* Leverage Cloud, DevOps, DevSecOps, AIOps, and containerization expertise to design, build, and deliver modernized infrastructure via scripting, workflows, and automation (i.e., Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC)).
* Leverage virtualization, IaaS/Paas, and Saas as a foundation to broker and deliver cloud and other services to the end customer.
* Automate configuration management, including modernization of network and systems administration functions.
* Develops advanced technological ideas and guides their development into a final product.
* Works under consultative direction toward pre-determined long-range goals and objectives.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Minimum Job Skills and Qualifications**


Minimum Qualifications:


* Bachelors and three (3) years or more experience.
* DOD Secret Clearance Required to begin, an interim Secret is acceptable to start work.
* CompTIA Security Plus Certification is required to begin work
* Must be able to pass a background check. May require additional background checks as required by projects and/or clients at any time during employment.


**Minimum Skills:**


* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to interact effectively with all levels throughout Company organization.
* Shall have the requisite skills, expertise, and experience to perform the requirements of each task. Must be extremely detail-oriented and well organized.
* Must have basic skills using Microsoft and Google Suite Products (Word, Excel, Power Point) and be able to learn new software as the situation dictates.


**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Application Migration
* SaaS delivery
* Automation (Terraform, Puppet & Ansible)
* Scripting (JavaScript, Powershell)
* REST API integration
* Git
* Practical knowledge of Agile and ITIL frameworks


**Reports to:** Program Manager


**Working Conditions**

* Professional office environment.
* Must be physically and mentally able to perform duties while standing for extended periods of time.
* Ability to use a computer and other office productivity tools with sufficient speed to meet the demands of this position.
* Must be able to establish a productive and professional workspace.
* Must be able to sit for long periods of time looking at computer screen.
* May be asked to work a flexible schedule which may include holidays.
* May be asked to travel for business or professional development purposes.
* May be asked to work hours outside of normal business hours.


**Other Duties:** *Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.*


**Affirmative Action/EEO Statement:** *Cayuse embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Cayuse, and all of its subsidiaries, are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and are an affirmative action employer**.*

title: Business Process and Data Integration Automation Engineer
description:
**Overview:**  
Are you an aficionado of automating business processes and workflows, with a keen eye for data integration? Do you find excitement in orchestrating complex workflows using tools like Zapier and delving deep into API integrations, including Twilio Studio for communication enhancements? If you're passionate about leveraging automation, Zapier, JSON, and APIs to anticipate and meet business needs, we have the perfect opportunity for you.

**About Us:**  
Based in Victoria, BC, Founders Together Capital is a leader in the digital marketing, eCommerce, and real estate investment sectors. Despite our headquarters' location, our team spans across Canada, operating in a fully remote environment. Within our Real Estate Marketing division, we've pioneered advanced automations to revolutionize buying and selling real estate remotely. Our ambition is to push the boundaries further, enhancing our process automation and data integration capabilities. As part of our team, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping our operational efficiency and strategic growth.

**Why Join Us:**

* Competitive Pay: We offer a competitive salary package that matches your experience and skills.
* Fully Remote Work: Enjoy the flexibility of working from anywhere in Canada, as our team operates 100% remotely.
* Competitive Vacation and Benefits: Our comprehensive benefits package includes generous vacation time, health benefits, and additional perks designed to support your work-life balance and well-being.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design and implement business process automations and workflows to streamline operations, with a specific focus on employing Twilio Studio for communication process enhancements.
* Develop and optimize workflow automations across various business areas, including sales pipelines and customer relationship management (CRM), using tools like Zapier, Pipedream, and Close.com.
* Integrate third-party data sources and manage CRM systems, ensuring seamless data flow and functionality that aligns with business strategies.
* Utilize JSON for data structuring and manipulation, alongside API integrations, to foster robust data exchange and system interoperability.
* Proactively identify automation opportunities and implement solutions that anticipate and address business needs, enhancing operational effectiveness and strategic decision-making.
* Engage in visualizing key performance indicators (KPIs), managing database setups, and enhancing web operations through browser automation tools like Browserless.io.

**Skills and Experience Required:**

* Demonstrated expertise in implementing automations with tools like Zapier, Pipedream, and familiarity with Twilio Studio for advanced communication solutions.
* Proficient in JSON and experienced in API integrations, with a strong understanding of how to leverage these technologies in predicting and fulfilling business requirements.
* Excellent analytical skills for mapping complex workflows, identifying automation opportunities, and seamlessly integrating various systems.
* A motivated self-starter who is responsive, trustworthy, and committed to excellence, capable of taking initiative, solving problems, and effectively communicating needs and solutions.
* Prior experience in real estate, project management, and familiarity with G-suite, WordPress, and data visualization platforms is advantageous.

**Position Details:**

This role offers the potential to evolve into a full-time position, starting part-time during an initial trial period if necessary. There is also the possibility to work on additional projects outside of the Real Estate Company, involving similar tasks and responsibilities. This flexibility is designed to accommodate the right candidate's situation and to ensure a mutual fit for long-term success.

**Join Our Team:**

If you're ready to dive into a role that sits at the intersection of business process automation, data integration, and strategic business development, while enjoying the benefits of a fully remote work environment, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits, we'd love to hear from you. Join us in our mission to transform the digital business landscape, leveraging the power of automation and data integration from anywhere in Canada.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $60,000.00-$99,019.00 per year

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental care
* Employee assistance program
* Extended health care
* Paid time off
* Work from home

Flexible Language Requirement:

* French not required

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

* Can you describe a complex automation workflow you've successfully implemented using Zapier, detailing the triggers, actions, and any challenges you faced in the process? Please include how you integrated multiple apps and any custom code or webhooks you utilized to achieve the desired outcome.
* Given the fully remote nature of our team and the importance of communication in managing business processes and data integration projects, how would you ensure effective collaboration and project management across different time zones and disciplines? Please share examples of tools and strategies you have used in the past to maintain high levels of productivity and team cohesion.
* How do you approach mapping out and understanding a new business process, and what steps do you take to translate that understanding into an effective automation solution? Please provide a specific example where you identified a business need, designed the automation to address it, and the impact it had on the business's efficiency or performance.
* In your experience with automations, how have you utilized OpenAI's capabilities to enhance business processes or workflows? Please describe a specific scenario where you integrated OpenAI technology into an automation, detailing the problem it solved and how you measured the success of this integration.
* Can you describe a scenario where you utilized Zapier to design a scalable backend system that accommodated a growing user base and feature requirements? Detail the specific Zaps you created, how you ensured scalability, and the impact it had on system performance and usability.

Work Location: Remote

title: Cloud Automation Engineer
description:
**Quick Position Facts!****Work Setting:** In-person, some remote opportunity, flexible working hours  

**Start Date:** April 2024  

**Salary Range:** $165,000 - $195,000 plus benefits
  

**Openings:** 1 Full-Time Role**G2 Ops will consider** **highly qualified** **remote applicants in the following states:** CA, CO, FL, ID, MD, RI, SC, VA, Washington D.C.

**\\*\\*Hiring Update\\*\\*** *We are currently interviewing Mid-Level Engineers, and up. Our Associate level opportunities are currently filled at this time. In addition, we are only interviewing candidates who currently possess an* ***Active DoD Secret Clearance, or higher,*** *due to contractual obligations.*

 **Knowledge Requirements:*** Automation of infrastructure deployment using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager (ARM), or Cloud Development Kit (CDK).
* Configuration of systems using automation tools such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet or Saltstack.
* Configuration of systems using native scripting languages such as PowerShell or Bash or general-purpose scripting languages such as Python.

  

**What makes someone choose one company over another?** Pay, benefits, training, work satisfaction, culture? What if you can have it all? At G2 Ops, we have extremely competitive pay and benefits but that is not even the best part. Our culture is what sets us apart from other companies. With us, you will not be another payroll number or a cog in the machine. We provide great value to our customers by working as a team and ensuring every member is set up for success. Our team approach allows for each member to not only provide value with their expertise but also gives them the opportunity to cross-train in other areas they have interest in.  

  

**Let's talk salary.** The salary range for this position is **$165,000 and goes up to $195,000** based on what we are asking you to do, and your qualifications. We also offer a competitive benefits package and have fringe benefits offered throughout the year. The benefits have an estimated value of $21,000 annually. With company standard annual performance reviews in place, plus excellence awards for recognition, your performance will be rewarded and appreciated; we promise!  

  

**So, you want to work from home?** Let's be honest, remote work is not always all it's cut out to be. At G2 Ops, we offer a flexible schedule to meet the needs of our employees and customers. Due to the classification level of the projects we support, we are not able to offer fully remote opportunities at this time. As a Defense Contractor, we are frequently working with sensitive material, and therefore, we need to ensure where you access your work is secure. You will have a shiny desk at our G2 Ops office and the ability to telework with prior approval. Here's the thing, we have worked very hard to create an awesome culture where our employees get to come to a collaborative, exciting office environment and we want you to join the fun!  

  

**Still not convinced?** Allow us to elaborate. For this opportunity, we are seeking a highly motivated, team-oriented **Cloud Automation Engineer**. This exciting position will have the chance to work on just about any aspect there is as it pertains to the cloud. We are seeking expertise with automation tools such as Terraform and Ansible. The ideal candidate will have 11+ years of relevant cloud and security experience.  

  

Lastly, as we are working for the DoD, we are beholden to some requirements. The ideal candidate would already possess an active **DoD Secret level clearance** and certifications such as Security+ and an Associate-level cloud certification (e.g. AWS SysOps)**.** Don’t let it stop you from applying if you don’t have a clearance. We’re willing to work with the right candidate to obtain clearance.  

  

**Quick Reminder**, we are seeking a full-time team member; the continuation of outside employment shall not constitute a conflict with the Company’s interest, including performing work for a customer or competitor.  

  

**Congratulations**, you made it all the way to the end of this job posting! We look forward to learning more about you!**Benefits**


* 100% company-paid insurance for medical, dental, and vision for eligible employees and family members
* 100% company-paid insurance for life, short-term (STD) and long-term disability (LTD) for eligible employees
* 401(K) Plan with discretionary employer matching
* 10 paid holidays
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Educational assistance
* Work/life balance
* Family-oriented culture
* Competitive salaries


**About G2 Ops, Inc.**


G2 Ops, Inc. is a small business with big capabilities in cyber security architectural analysis, model-based systems engineering (MBSE), and strategic consulting in support of both government and commercial clients across the globe. As a trusted and reliable government contractor, we deliver cyber security & systems engineering support for integrated DoD weapons, communications, intelligence, and other mission-critical systems. In the commercial space, we provide business solutions analysis, strategic planning, and training and development services to a variety of public and private sector businesses and organizations. Through innovative solutions, exceptional employees, top-tier analytical capabilities, and a customer-centered focus, G2 Ops has established a reputation for service excellence and innovation.


**G2 Ops, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Staff Product Security Engineer, Security Education
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.


The Security team's mission is to strengthen Okta's position as the leading Identity-as-a-service solutions provider by identifying and resolving risks to employees, products, and, most importantly, our customers. With the ever-increasing pace of cloud application adoption, companies are struggling to find ways to accurately assess risk and act at the speed of their business



As a **Staff Product Security Engineer focusing on Security Education** at Okta, your role is pivotal in fostering a 'security-first' mindset throughout the organization. Your passion for security and commitment to education will inspire you to develop innovative and diverse training materials tailored to various learning styles. These resources are essential in enhancing the security expertise of our engineering teams.



We're looking for a candidate who combines a deep knowledge of security practices with an acute ability to convey this knowledge effectively. Your efforts will be vital in integrating a robust security mindset into the core of our company culture at Okta. Your role is not just about teaching security; it's about transforming how we think about and approach security daily.

  


**What You'll Do**
------------------


* Collaborate closely with engineering teams to understand their current security training needs and identify new educational opportunities
* Create engaging and varied educational content that caters to different learning preferences, ensuring all engineering team members understand and apply security principles
* Play a pivotal role in cultivating a strong security culture within Okta, emphasizing the importance of security in every aspect of our work, including initiatives such as our Security Champions program
* Collaborate closely with teams across Product Security, ensuring a cohesive and comprehensive approach to educating and interfacing with engineering departments
* Stay informed of the latest security threats, trends, and technologies to keep training materials up-to-date with current best practices and emerging threats

  


**What You Bring**
------------------


* Minimum of 8 years of experience in Application or Product Security teams or similar roles
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex security concepts to technical and non-technical audiences
* In-depth knowledge of modern web application vulnerabilities and remediations (e.g., OWASP Top 10, CWE Top 25).
* Ability to quickly learn and teach various security topics such as threat modeling, shifting left, cloud security, etc.
* Experience working with cross-functional teams, possessing exceptional stakeholder management skills, and the ability to work independently

  



#LI-Remote



#LI-CH1


Below is the annual salary range for candidates located in Canada. Your actual salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Okta offers equity (where applicable), bonus, and benefits, including health, dental, and vision insurance, RRSP with a match, healthcare spending, telemedicine, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. To learn more about our Total Rewards program, please visit: https://rewards.okta.com/can.

**The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in Canada is between:**


$131,000—$197,000 CAD**What you can look forward to as an Okta employee!**


* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Fostering Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.



Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Network Automation Architect - Digital Velocity
description:
**Summary**  

The Solutions Architects for Network Automation are responsible for providing highly technical design and implementation consulting to our enterprise technical customers. The Solutions Architects are highly qualified, experienced, personable and knowledgeable across many different languages, processes and toolsets. As a company, we provide both training and hands-on consulting to our customers to help them move forward with contemporary IT strategies.



**Key areas of responsibility**


* Architect, Develop & Implement innovative software solutions related to the automation of network infrastructure in the enterprise.
* Technologies will include Git, Python, Jenkins, Network platforms (Cisco, Juniper, ICOS, SONiC), ROBOT framework
* Work with I&O teams to develop automations strategies for private data center stacks - Experience or at least strong understanding of networks as it pertains to base protocols, topologies, routing, switching.
* Manipulation of network devices through REST API or other methods available
* Complex multi-layered logic creation for validation and testing
* Potential work with software languages which will include node.js, Go, Java, PHP, Ruby and COTS based application distributions
* Utilize CI/CD Processes and suggest or Automate Paths Forward to Mitigate those Weaknesses
* Collaboration: Work with your peers within your team and outside your team to help develop these solutions. Work with leaders at customer locations to help advise them on how best to achieve their DevOps goals
* Learning and Teaching: To be a continuous Learner. To generously teach others what you learn
* Feedback: To provide respectful yet honest feedback to leadership about how to better achieve the DevOps goals
* Knowledgeable: To be Knowledgeable about the DevOps and the need for application teams to adopt Best Practices




Education and/or Experience qualifications


* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience
* 5+ years of Providing Technical Guidance to Engineers
* 5+ years of experience in deployment of private/public cloud solutions
* Knowledge and skill level in identified competencies meet minimum requirements for role
* Previous direct customer consulting experience or equivalent understanding of role responsibilities

Required qualifications


* 5+ years of Python Software Development
* 3+ Years of experience within a DevOps structure
* Demonstrate an expert level of understanding and experience with at least 1 CI/CD technology
* Hashicorp Tools (Terraform, Consul, Vault, Nomad)
* GitHub Experience
* Development experience using REST
* Experience with CI servers
* IXIA traffic generation
* Jenkins and Jenkinsfile development
* Knowledge of Kubernetes or OpenShift
* Experience working with an Agile team
* CCNA or CCNP certification

title: Intermediate Instrumentation and Control Engineer
description:
**There’s no pledge more important than the one we make to look after our environment, and we’re committed to helping you do exactly that.** 

**Who are we looking for?** 

We’re looking for an Intermediate Instrumentation & Control Engineer to join our team. To be successful, you must have a minimum of 7+ years of municipal and design experience and possess P.ENG with PEO.

**In an ever-changing world, it requires creativity and innovation to stay ahead.**

We’re seeking the curious, those who are stimulated by fresh thinking and a desire to shape our communities in new, positive ways.

As part of a truly global team, working on complex and rewarding projects, you'll be at the forefront of driving change. See what the power of commitment can do for you.

**Join us as we strive to ensure a sustainable future for our communities and the world, we live in.** 

Become part of our global network of skilled engineers, scientists, auditors, planners, and environmental specialists, all working together to leave this world better than we found it.

**Working with an energetic and high-performing team, this position offers a variety of work and will see you involved in:**

* Planning and owning the delivery of Instrumentation and Control systems designs,
* Providing solutions to fit the needs of our clients and communities, including industrial, municipal, and transit markets,
* Providing design and engineering to assure that design and equipment meet customer specifications and industry codes and standards,
* Participating in a multi-disciplinary environment in determining the instrumentation, controls, and process automation requirements,
* Preparing studies, reports, and technical memoranda,
* Developing detailed engineering packages and construction documents to represent installation requirements for process control systems and instrumentation,
* Preparation of deliverables including drawings (Process and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs), riser diagrams, control schematics, loop drawings, control panels, networks and communication systems diagrams, installation details), bills of materials (BOMs) specifications, IO lists and schedules (equipment, instruments, devices, cables, etc.),
* Verifying accuracy and completeness of all deliverable products and services in assigned areas of responsibility,
* Field inspections, traveling to fabrication sites, installation sites, and client facilities as needed to support projects’ requirements,
* Support of construction activities, review of shop drawings, participation in site inspections, resolving ongoing issues, support of equipment and control system testing (FAT/SAT) and commissioning, troubleshooting of the control systems,
* Assisting and contributing to the preparation of proposals and bids for projects.

**What you will bring to the team:**

* Proven excellence at all stages of the project life cycle, from preparing bids to feasibility studies, consenting, detailed design and data analysis, and stakeholder management.
* Demonstrate professional judgement and commercial acumen, including identifying, assessing, evaluating issues.
* Robust written and verbal skills, with the ability to communicate complex issues concisely.
* An interest in coaching and mentoring to technically strengthen the team's capabilities.

**Must have:**

* P. Eng. designation with PEO;
* 7+ years of municipal engineering and design experience
* Strong working knowledge of P&ID drawings, instrumentation and control systems design, networking and fieldbuses, process automation, building automation systems, communication systems, access and security systems, CCTV, etc.
* Applicant’s background should include, and be able to implement design based on Client’s specific guidelines,
* Able to provide input in all project life cycle, starting with proposals, leading design activities, and being on top of schedule, budget, and quality. Collaborate with project management team for change management processes, tendering, and construction support.

**Required skills and job duties:**

* Background performing related design and engineering consulting services for a wide variety of industrial and municipal clients.
* Demonstrated proficiency in problem solving and troubleshooting.
* Effective communication skills, both written and verbal
* Experience with industry business and engineering software
* Demonstrated success in meeting or exceeding the expectations of customers and partners and in meeting organizational mission commitments and deliverables.
* Demonstrated ability in effective communication with subordinates, peers, and superiors.

**Take on some of the world’s toughest challenges - with everyone at GHD backing you every step of the way.**

We'll give you control over your career, empower you to find innovative solutions, and help you create a lasting impact.

**See where your commitment could take you with GHD.**

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $86,000.00-$125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Casual dress
* Dental care
* Extended health care
* Flexible schedule
* Language training provided
* Life insurance
* On-site parking
* RRSP match
* Vision care
* Wellness program
* Work from home

Flexible Language Requirement:

* French not required

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

* Salary expectation?

Education:

* Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

* municipal engineering and design: 7 years (required)
* industry business and engineering software: 7 years (required)

Licence/Certification:

* P.ENG with Ontario (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Markham, ON L3R 5Y8

Expected start date: 2024-03-11

title: Implementation Engineer | CPQ
description:
### **General information**

Office (s)
Remote, Canada
Date Published
Tuesday, February 13, 2024
Country
Canada
Job ID
22470
Function
Professional Services
Recruiter
Olagbaju, Fehintola
### **Description & Requirements**

**Implementation Engineer | CPQ:** The Implementation Engineer is responsible for building custom user interfaces and advanced product rules that automate the design/quote process. You will be exposed to a full range of manufacturing products, from simple to very complex, that will need advanced configuration and pricing algorithms. You will use your enterprise software knowledge to dig deep into customer’s issues and goals, learn about their products and business processes, and then develop them a fully integrated solution. Solutions almost always involve other business systems (like ERP, CRM, CAD, etc) so a general knowledge of this space is critical. Your project team will include skilled mechanical engineers and programmers that solve bottlenecks in sales/engineering/manufacturing workflows. Your expertise will help them automate and accelerate processes for their custom products. You will be comfortable talking to customers and demoing your work in front of small audiences. Communication is paramount at Epicor CPQ. **What you will be doing:**

* Understand the customer’s business requirements and translate their needs into solutions.
* Develop and maintain custom configurator user interfaces.
* Develop and maintain advanced product configuration rules and advanced pricing algorithms.
* Traveling to customer sites to learn about customer products & business processes.
* Working with IT & engineering teams at customer sites to improve existing quote & design processes
* Interact with members of

cross-functional teams.  

* Identify issues and risks and report to the Project Manager with suggested direction.
* Ensure project deliverables are completed on time and anticipate issues or conditions that may impact the original estimate or project budget.
* Meet utilization targets and complete project deliverables on time.
* Demonstrate a high level of functional knowledge of the modules associated with their respective certification track.
* Other duties as assigned.

 **What you'll bring:**  

* CPQ knowledge required.
* Familiar with remote work environments and capable of working in a virtual office environment.
* Strong experience with at least one programming language (examples: javascript, C#, VB.NET).
* Must be comfortable speaking to customers both over the phone and in-in person
* General knowledge of

enterprise-level software systems like ERP & CRM.  

* Must be genuinely interested in solving complex process problems for manufacturing companies.
* Excellent

communication, both written and verbal, and presentation skills.  

* Analytical abilities and

problem-solving skills. **Qualifications:**

* BS/BA in Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
* 2+ years of experience taking complex customer and product concepts and developing solutions.

 **Extras:**  

* Experience automating CAD models with macros or any other CAD automation technology.
* Working with manufacturing companies

**The Professional Services Team**
Professional Services play an instrumental role in the growth of Epicor. You will be working with our customers to implement our products and ensure that we continuously provide an exceptional customer experience. Almost every position is customer-facing—therefore, it’s important to have energy, drive, and determination to ensure Epicor gives the best possible experience to all clients. This passion will contribute to the success of your career and the company. If you are looking for a global, innovative company with strong roots and exciting growth, Epicor is ready to hear from you!
**About Epicor**


At Epicor we know that success comes from working together. Everyone has a role to play, and it’s the essential partnerships across our company that are crucial to our customers’ success and our growth as a business.


We’re truly a team. Working in close partnership, we bring wide-ranging talents together in powerful collaborations. We think innovatively, share our knowledge generously, and constantly learn from our colleagues. We’re proud of the success we achieve every day, but we never stop challenging ourselves and encouraging each other. Together, we go further and imagine an even brighter future.


Whatever your career journey, we’ll help you find the right path. Through our training courses, mentorship, and continuous support, you’ll get everything you need to thrive. At Epicor, your success is our success. And that success really matters, because we’re the essential partners for the world’s most essential businesses—the hardworking companies who make, move, and sell the things the world needs.


**Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement**


Epicor is committed to creating a workplace and global community where inclusion is valued; where you bring the whole and real you—that’s who we’re interested in. If you have interest in this or any role- but your experience doesn’t match every qualification of the job description, that’s okay- consider applying regardless.


We are an equal-opportunity employer.


#LI-TO1 #LI-Remote

title: Sr. Automation & Process Engineer
description:
The Marmon Group LLC
Come join a team where People make the difference! As a part of Marmon Holdings, Inc., a highly decentralized organization, we rely heavily on people with the aptitude, attitude, and entrepreneurial spirit to drive our success, and we're committed to attracting and retaining top talent.


Marmon is a $12 billion industrial conglomerate with over 200 industrial facilities in North America. Over the past 2 years, the Innovation and Automation group has led or assisted with factory and robotic automation projects at multiple facilities and had remarkable success. We’ve deployed dozens of new automation systems and pieces of factory equipment. We’re now scaling our team, process, and reach to execute or assist with dozens of projects per year.  

  

Marmon is now looking for an engineer and leader with extensive process, operations, and LEAN experience to join our growing factory automation team. Is your experience light in one of these areas? No problem! Bring your excellent engineering skills, drive to learn, and we’ll teach you the rest!  

  

Why Marmon?
  

  

Are you a builder? Do you like to define your own solutions and then execute them? Are you tired of the “stay in your lane” attitude? We’re on a mission to help our 200+ businesses invest in themselves by demystifying and streamlining the process of adding factory automation. We’re a group of Engineers identifying blockers, building tools, and executing on projects in the factory automation space. Everyone on the team is empowered and expected to make changes to improve the way we do things. You’ll get exposure across all of our business segments to industry-leading executives, engineers, and factories. If this sounds exciting, Marmon is the place for you!  

  

This role will involve 40-70% travel. Have your home base at our Chicago or Houston innovation hubs, one of our many manufacturing facilities, or work remote during non-travel periods.**What You’ll Do:**

* Lead 3-4 simultaneous projects
* Act as individual contributor on 1-3 projects; mentor and guide Jr. engineers on 1-3 additional projects
* Mentor and guide others as required. Leadership opportunities available if desired
* Leverage Jr engineers for technical problem solving as needed
* Use your skills in process and LEAN to build project scopes which use automation technology to improve factory process flow and optimize ROI or other KPI’s
* Map existing factory processes, educate businesses on bottlenecks, propose and implement future states which align with business growth and investment goals
* Own responsibility for technical project leadership. Use prior engineering knowledge or gain new knowledge to be the project technical expert
* Use engineering knowledge and subject matter experts to architect automation solutions
* Spearhead technology research to deliver state-of-the-art processes and designs
* Work across multiple facilities with separate stakeholder teams and processes
* Work with project managers to set and manage goals, deliverables, and timelines
* Build payback models and assist in writing capital requests
* Use existing Marmon automation implementation process to guide your workflow
* Update and improve Marmon processes as you learn. Contribute to shared knowledge base
* Attend trade shows, vendor visits, etc., to become a rounded industry expert on current state of the art technologies and implementation strategies
* Teach and mentor businesses to continue executing projects


#LI-Remote

**What You’ll Bring to the Role:**

* Preferred degree areas: Mechanical engineering, Industrial engineering, Automation engineering, and Project management / Operations
* 5-15+ years’ work experience in Operations, Process engineering, LEAN, Automation, and similar
* Comfortable in ambiguous situations where requirements may be unclear
* Comfortable setting your own agenda to accomplish goals when needed
* Comfortable in factory environments
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment
* Knowledge of LEAN principles
* 40-70% travel, domestic
* Strong organizational skills
* **MUST be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship**

If this sounds like you, let’s talk! We’re building something pretty cool here, and this is an opportunity you won’t want to miss!


Following receipt of a conditional offer of employment, candidates will be required to complete additional job-related screening processes as permitted or required by applicable law.


We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to careers@marmon.com, and please be sure to include the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.

title: Sales Engineer / Account Manager - Semiconductor Industry, Automated Test Equipment
description:
We are the global test and automation specialists, powering next-generation technologies through sophisticated solutions. Behind every electronic device you use, Teradyne's test technology ensures your device works right the first time, every time! Our portfolio of automation solutions help manufacturers to develop and deliver products quickly, efficiently and cost-effectively. Together, Teradyne companies deliver manufacturing automation across industries and applications around the world!


We are the global test and automation specialists, powering next-generation technologies through sophisticated solutions. Behind every electronic device you use, Teradyne's test technology ensures your device works right the first time, every time! Our portfolio of automation solutions help manufacturers to develop and deliver products quickly, efficiently and cost-effectively. Together, Teradyne companies deliver manufacturing automation across industries and applications around the world!

  

Teradyne’s semiconductor test solutions bring the technology of tomorrow to market fast and with high quality. We are transforming the way the industry tests chipsets for automotive, industrial, communications, consumer, smartphones, and computer and electronic game applications.  

  

Teradyne has an opportunity for an experienced Account Manager/Sales Engineer. Do you possess a unique blend of Engineering background, Semiconductor industry experience, a strong desire to advocate for and support customers while influencing our company’s sales and product roadmap?  

  

This individual is not only seasoned at the selling profession but has significant ATE or related experience and excels in managing a Customer Team. She/He can work independently with little supervision and can also manage a customer team on a global basis. Both the company and customer see and rely on this person as an expert.  

  

**Duties & Responsibilities**  

  

* Advocate for and Support the Customer, while aligning to the objectives of Teradyne.
* Manage and grow the business for established and new customers.
* Create and implement sales strategy using strategic sales tools and processes.
* Manage all activities related to maintaining existing and gaining new market share and meeting sales quota: identify and qualify opportunities, manage the competitive sales process, align Teradyne product roadmaps, forecast, quote and book orders.
* Coordinate sales strategies worldwide for the assigned Customers (including integration with Teradyne worldwide test subcontract sales teams).
* Develop relationships at all levels within the Customers’ organizations and within Teradyne.
* Must be willing to travel approximately 30-40% of the time.

  

  

**Qualifications, Experience, & Skills**  

  

* 10 plus years of experience in capital equipment sales or marketing within the Semiconductor or a related industry.
* Proven ability to drive long sales cycle design-ins.
* Highly empathetic to Customer needs.
* Excellent communication and analytical skills.


  

**Education**  

  

* BSEE or equivalent work experience. MBA a plus.
  

#LI-JL2


#LI-Remote

title: Advanced Industrial Controls Engineer
description:
Who we are
With its A.I.-powered robotic technology platform, Symbotic is changing the way consumer goods move through the supply chain. Intelligent software orchestrates advanced robots in a high-density, end-to-end system – reinventing warehouse automation for increased efficiency, speed and flexibility.
What we need
We are looking for an Advanced Industrial Controls Engineer to join our Industrial Automation team within our Industrial Controls organization. This position will report to the Senior Manager, Industrial Controls Engineering and will play an important part in driving the execution of the PLC (Programmable Logic Controllers) development and implementation. The ideal candidate is customer driven and proactive fetching information and discuss with the end user.
What we do
The Industrial Automation team is part of the Industrial Controls organization which develops products for our warehouse automation systems. With a proven track record in industrial control specification, design implementation, standard engineering practices and documentation; their mission is to research new platforms, utilize advanced hardware, and push the limits of technology to build a world-class automation platform that minimizes development time, reduces commissioning time, and eliminates unplanned downtime.
What you’ll do* Elaborate, define, and plan technical work from well-defined objectives, validating requirements with internal and external stakeholders.
* Lead the execution of test strategies, execute test plan, generate test reports, and demonstrate compliance with requirements.
* Independently execute technical work.
* Autonomous and self-driving, requiring minimal supervision.
* Participate in design review for technical solutions within existing architectures.
* Gather information and validate requirements to execute root cause analysis to resolve issues with internal and external stakeholders.
* Provide new control system functionalities and modify existing solutions which includes PLC and HMI.
* Document equipment configuration, system functionality and features, and Industrial Controls team processes and procedures.
* Collaborate with Release management and perform PLC and HMI updates for the customer, on-site or remotely.
* Support customers to address unforeseen issues and Production sites.
* Contribute to process improvement initiatives.
* 40% Travel Required - Various customer locations (Canada and United States).


What you’ll need* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical engineering, Controls Engineering or Automation Engineer or Computer science or in a related discipline.
* Knowledge of Power Systems to design drive controls.
* Experience with AC/DC Drive Control Architecture.
* 5+ years’ in Design & Implementation of Industrial Control systems using PLCs, HMIs, and Drives.
* 5+ years’ of Programming PLCs, HMIs, and related equipment for Industrial Control Systems (Rockwell products preferred).
* 5+ years’ experience with automated systems engineering.
* Advanced experience programming Rockwell PLC’s (ControlLogix, GuardLogix).
* Advanced knowledge of Industrial networks.
* Experience developing and programming Human Machine Interface (Ignition 8, FactoryTalk ME/SE).
* Able to understand and read electrical and mechanical schematics.
* Strong background in troubleshooting complex automated system.
* Experience with JIRA and agile methodology.
* Knowledge in Inductive Automation products is a plus.


#LI-Remote
#LI-PG1
About Symbotic
Symbotic is an automation technology leader reimagining the supply chain with its end-to-end, AI-powered robotic and software platform. Symbotic reinvents the warehouse as a strategic asset for the world’s largest retail, wholesale, and food & beverage companies. Applying next-gen technology, high-density storage and machine learning to solve today's complex distribution challenges, Symbotic enables companies to move goods with unmatched speed, agility, accuracy and efficiency. As the backbone of commerce the Symbotic platform transforms the flow of goods and the economics of supply chain for its customers. For more information, visit www.symbotic.com.  

We are a community of innovators, collaborators and pioneers who embrace our differences, because we know unique perspectives make us stronger and smarter. Every perspective matters. We depend on the collective voices of our employees, customers and community to help guide us as we build a better place to work – for you and the world. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.
